audience.timeLeft: TIME LEFT UNTIL THE NEXT EVENT
audience.timer:
This countdown timer
shows how much time left until: 03 October, 2024

welcome.heading: Dear friends from all over the world!
welcome.para1: It gives us great pleasure to welcome you to the EAFO OncoPathology Courses to be held in various cities of Russian Federation. As usual, like every other EAFO event, this course will follow the same principles of bringing together the north, south, east and west on one platform.
welcome.para2: The course will comprise of theory sessions and interactive case discussions:
welcome.molecularBiologists: Specialists in Molecular Biology, Genetics, Oncology
welcome.para3: This event will give you a unique opportunity to communicate with world-renowned experts in the field of morphological and molecular genetic diagnostics & management of neoplasms.
welcome.para4: We look forward to your participation in this unique courses which will take place in 2025:
welcome.li1: 45th EAFO OncoPathology Course «HematoLymphoid Tumors», Russian Federation;
welcome.li2: 46th EAFO OncoPathology Course «HepatoPancreaticBilliary Tumors», Russian Federation;
welcome.li3: 47th EAFO OncoPathology Course «Breast Tumors», within the framework of VI EAFO Kazan Breast Cancer Forum, Kazan, Republic of Tatarstan, Russian Federation.

about.title: About EAFO
about.content: The Eurasian Federation of Oncology is a unique international professional organization comprising of invited experts involved in the prevention, diagnosis, treatment of cancer, drug development, basic research and also representatives of patient organizations and cancer survivors.

courses.title: Join us at EAFO OncoPathology Courses
courses.list:
• 1. 45th EAFO OncoPathology Course «HematoLymphoid Tumors», 03–07 October 2024, Moscow, Russian Federation;
  • 2. 46th EAFO OncoPathology Course «HepatoPancreaticBilliary Tumors», 13–17 October 2024, Moscow, Russian Federation;
  • 3. 47th EAFO OncoPathology Course «Breast Tumors», within the framework of VI EAFO Kazan Breast Cancer Forum, 06–10 November 2024, Kazan, Republic of Tatarstan, Russian Federation.
courses.para1: Don't miss this opportunity to take part in this unique 5-day curriculum providing up-to-date theory and practical case discussions with world renowned experts.
courses.para2: Register now to be part in this exceptional program and update/refresh your knowledge in this rapidly evolving field.

commonPage.title2:
46th EAFO OncoPathology Course
Hepato Pancreatic Biliary Tumors
commonPage.subtitle: 2025 | Russian Federation

partVariants.title: Participation Variants
partVariants.subtitle: EAFO offers you residential, non-residential and online options.
partVariants.para1: Opt for the on-site without accommodation participation option at the EAFO Oncopathology Courses  for a flexible and enriching learning journey. Attend all course sessions, workshops, and interactive activities on campus while having the flexibility to commute from your preferred accommodation outside the campus. Benefit from the proximity to the course venue without the need for overnight stays, allowing you to customize your schedule according to your personal preferences and commitments. Connect with leading experts, faculty members, and peers during breaks, networking opportunities, and social events, fostering professional relationships and knowledge sharing.
partVariants.para2: Join the EAFO Oncopathology Courses  from anywhere in the world through our online participation variant. Access live-streamed sessions, virtual workshops, and interactive discussions from the comfort of your home or office. Engage with course content in real-time, participate in Q&A sessions, and connect with faculty members and other online participants through virtual networking opportunities. Benefit from the flexibility of online participation, allowing you to customize your learning experience based on your schedule and preferences. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in pathology research and expand your professional network without the need for travel.

compParticipation.title: Extra Subsidized Participation
compParticipation.subtitle: (Competitive Participation)
compParticipation.desc: Extra Subsidized participation for the EAFO OncoPathology Courses on "HematoLymphoid Tumors" offers a unique opportunity for eligible individuals to attend this event at a reduced cost. This special initiative aims to make the course more accessible to a wider audience, including students, UG & PG Students, PhD Scholars, researchers, and healthcare professionals (under 40 years of age) with limited financial resources.
compParticipation.criteriaDesc: Criteria for extra subsidized participation in the course:​​​​
compParticipation.criteriaList:
• Age: not more than 40 years (as of 31 October 2024)
  • Motivation Letter
  • Resume/CV
  • Letter of recommendation (Optional)
  • Take part in the online test - The link for the online test will be sent to you separately by email
compParticipation.box1: To qualify for the Extra Subsidized Participation Category, you have to be under the age of 40 and take part in the online test
compParticipation.box2: You will also be required to fill in an additional form along with the registration form in order to take part in the selection
compParticipation.conditionsList:
• Priority will be given to those whose Abstract (or) Pathology Case has been Submitted/Accepted
  • No Travel Support will be given
  • Priority will be given to the applicants residing in Low & Middle Income Countries (as per World Bank data)
  • Provide Maximum Information in the Application
compParticipation.footerText: Participants who qualify for extra subsidized participation will benefit from full access to entire program, including lectures, interactive panel discussions and other planned activities including catering.

awards.title: Awards
awards.description: The course will conclude with an award ceremony. Based on their performance throughout the course, selected participants will be offered the following awards:

list.title: First Prize
list.description:
Medium Term Fellowship with EAFO Certificate: 4 weeks to 4 months.

Long Term Training Fellowship: 4 months to 6 years.

Training under the leadership of senior renowned pathologists in leading departments of Pathology centers in Russia and India. This will include exposure to HistoPathology, CytoPathology, HematoPathology and Molecular-Genetic Diagnostics.

PostGraduate training Certificates/Diplomas in Pathological Anatomy, Clinical Laboratory Diagnostics and Oncology will be given issued based on the courses opted.

list.title: Second Prize
list.description: Short Term Fellowships in leading institutions/laboratories in Russia or India: 1 to 3 weeks

list.title: Third Prize
list.description: Free registration for a future EAFO Event.

list.title: Fifth Prize
list.description: One year access to the online version of the WHO Classification of Tumors.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: EAFO’s mission is reflected in its motto "Uniting Continents in Fighting Cancer", which emphasizes the need for global cooperation in combating cancer. The core purpose of the organization is to provide and facilitate cancer education by making knowledge accessible to all sections of the society. Though the name of the organization denotes a confined region, its activities and out-reach are not restricted to the Eurasian continent thereby making it an inclusive organization open to collaborations and partnerships from all parts of the world.

eafo.title: About EAFO
eafo.description: Eurasian Federation of Oncology (EAFO) is an autonomous professional organization uniting oncologists, other healthcare professionals, anti-cancer & anti-tobacco advocates, patients, survivors, journalists, policy makers, oncology & anti-cancer organizations and others interested in combating cancer from all parts of Asia, Europe and beyond. The organization has its focus on long-term initiatives dedicated to the health and well being of cancer patients, cancer survivors, healthy individuals, initiatives that foster innovations, collegiality, cooperation and professional development primarily through educational programs

studyTrials.title: Study/Clinical Trials
studyTrials.description: EAFO is involved in conducting and coordinating pre-clinical, clinical and epidemiological studies.

multiDisciplinaryTeam.title: Multidisciplinary Team
multiDisciplinaryTeam.description: The speakers and participants in EAFO events include Medical, Surgical & Radiation Oncologists, Diagnostic & Interventional Radiologists, Pathologists, Genetists & Molecular Biologists, Basic Researchers, Family Physicians, Anti-Cancer & Anti-Tobacco Advocates, Patients, Survivors, Policy Makers, Journalists and Politicians.

top.title: Payment Options
bullets: The registration fees can be paid by Bank Transfer or online payment gateway.
If you opt for bank transfer option, the following are the options available depending on the country of your bank.
Payments are accepted only in Russian Rubles (RUB) and Indian Rupees (INR).
notes: After you make the payment, please send the bank transfer confirmation and your name to travel@eafo.info.
If you are using a credit/debit card for payment, please refer to the link provided in the email you received.
Please ensure that you carefully go through the payment options to prevent any potential legal or payment-related complications.

tabs.outside: Paying from any bank outside Russia
tabs.russia: Paying from Russian Bank or any other bank in Russian Rubles

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: If you have any queries in regards to the event, please don't hesitate to contact us and we assure you that we would get back to you as soon as possible.
